column3: Fundamentals of Electromagnetism (2)IPSE Course
column4: モッツ　ホルガー　マルティン
column6: 自然科学　物理学　必修
column15: 初級レベル（入門・導入）
column23:
The lecture script (presentation slides) is uploaded on Course-Navi before each lesson.

Suitable accompanying textbooks are:
* Physics (Tipler P.)
* Physics for Scientists and Engineers (Tipler P., Mosca G)
* Physics for Scientists and Engineers with Modern Physics (Tipler P., Mosca G)
* Physics for Scientists and Engineers with Modern Physics (Serway R., Jewett J.)
The electromagnetism part in these books is very similar, as they are all based on the original version by Paul A. Tipler.

The following books are useful for complementary self-study:
* Electricity and Magnetism, Edward M.Purcell & David J. Morin
* A Student's Guide To Maxwell's Equations, Fleisch, D.

column3: Advanced GeometryIPSE Course
column15: 上級レベル
column23:
There is no textbook, but reading material will be distributed during the lectures. Any undergraduate textbook on complex analysis can be consulted for introductory material.

Two recommended references for advanced material are (1) L. Ahlfors, "Complex Analysis", McGraw-Hill 1966; (2) G. A. Jones and D. Singerman "Complex Functions: an algebraic and geometrical viewpoint", Cambridge University Press 1987.

Each group is required to make one or two presentations (depending on the number of the registered students) and to hand in the two reports (also for the case of no presentation). 50 is the full score. Clarity of the presetantion(s) and whether reasonable anayses are written in the reports are evaluated. column3: 基礎の数学　基幹(3)-I
column15: 初級レベル（入門・導入）
column23:
必要に応じて講義中プリントを配布する.

授業の補完として
大学新入生のための基礎数学 米田元, 本間泰史, 高橋大輔著 サイエンス社
を用いるので購入すること. ただし講義の順番は本とは異なる.

（1）山田直平原著，桜井誠著：”電気磁気学（3版改訂）”

さらに参考書として，以下を挙げる．
（3）ファインマン著：”ファインマン物理学III　電磁気学”，（岩波書店）
（4）橋本淳一郎著：”電磁気学ノート”，ほか

column3: 回路理論A
column15: 中級レベル（発展・応用）
column23:
エース　電気回路理論入門　朝倉書店　　奥村浩士著

理工系低学年を対象に、高校で学んだ数学と物理の知識をもとに直流回路の理論から入り、インダクタ、キャパシタを含む回路の微分方程式、二端子対回路などについて解説。

column3: 回路理論B
column15: 中級レベル（発展・応用）
column23:
特に指定しないが、シラバスの内容をカバーする教科書をそろえた方がよい。
また、計算過程も含めた問題集を用意して自習するのが好ましい。
推薦書籍：
（1）大野克郎・西哲生　大学課程電気回路(I)　オーム社(1968, 2004)．
（2）西　哲生　基礎としての回路　コロナ社(2008)．
（3）大附辰夫，過渡回路解析，電気学会，オーム社．
（4）柳沢健，回路理論基礎，電気学会，オーム社．
（5）奥村浩士，電気回路理論入門，朝倉書店，2002．

column24: [{"name"=>"試験", "rate"=>"80％", "detail"=>"授業の中間時点で中間試験，最終回に期末試験を行う。試験は授業で学習した重要事項について、きちんと習得しているかどうかを評価する視点で行う。難問・奇問は出題しないが、基礎事項が習得できていないと合格点は取れないので、授業で説明した基礎事項の習得に全力を尽くすこと。中間試験，期末試験結果の成績への反映割合は，中間試験40%，期末試験40%とする。"}, {"name"=>"レポート", "rate"=>"0％", "detail"=>""}, {"name"=>"平常点評価", "rate"=>"20％", "detail"=>"原則として毎回の授業において、リアクションペーパー（Reaction paper）を出題する。リアクションペーパーの提出状況、記載内容を元に、平常点評価を行う。"}]

column3: 視覚芸術理論
column9: 01:63号館3階端末室Aルーム／01:63号館3階端末室Dルーム／01:63号館3階端末室Eルーム
column15: 中級レベル（発展・応用）
column23:
本講座では、今日の芸術および視覚表現の基礎となった原理を理解すると共に、簡単な実験と制作を試みたい。本講座で準備する用具、素材の他、以下の用具等については、履修生自身の準備も求めたい。準備については、授業内で説明する。

1) コンパス、定規(直定規、三角定規)、鉛筆・シャープペンシル・サインペン(細、太、カラー数色)、はさみ(第1,2回の授業時に持参すること)

2) 写真・動画撮影、インタラクション実験のために、スマートフォンやデジタルカメラ等(後半の授業で使用)
　
[教科書] 授業時に、資料配布、参考文献を紹介

column23:
• Textbook: Concept Building and Discussion - Foundations. DTP Publishing.

• Supplementary materials supplied by the teacher
column24:
[{"name"=>"試験", "rate"=>"30％", "detail"=>"Evaluation Details: This course has no final test. However, students will be administered two tests during the semester: a Mid-term Discussion Test worth 20%, and an Internet Research and Source Acknowledgement Quiz worth 10%."}, {"name"=>"レポート", "rate"=>"55％", "detail"=>"Evaluation Details: During the semester, students will need to complete four written assignments (each worth 10%) based on in-class discussions, and one final report (worth 15%)."}, {"name"=>"平常点評価", "rate"=>"15％", "detail"=>"Evaluation Details: Toward the end of the semester, students will need to make an oral presentation of findings obtained through a group project. Although the presentations will be done in small groups, grading will be based on each individual student’s contributions to the presentation. This assessment component is worth 15% of the final grade."}, {"name"=>"その他", "rate"=>"0％", "detail"=>"Other Requirements Relating to Evaluation
• Attendance Policy
Students must attend at least two-thirds of the lessons, or they will receive an ‘F’ for their final grade.
• Homework and Participation
Students are expected to complete an average of 90 minutes of homework each week to achieve a passing grade in this class. The homework will include written assignments, undertaking Internet- and library-based research, and preparing presentations."}]

column23:
• Textbook: Concept Building and Discussion - Foundations. DTP Publishing.

• Supplementary materials supplied by the teacher
column24:
[{"name"=>"試験", "rate"=>"30％", "detail"=>"Evaluation Details: This course has no final test. However, students will be administered two tests during the semester: a Mid-term Discussion Test worth 20%, and an Internet Research and Source Acknowledgement Quiz worth 10%."}, {"name"=>"レポート", "rate"=>"55％", "detail"=>"Evaluation Details: During the semester, students will need to complete four written assignments (each worth 10%) based on in-class discussions, and one final report (worth 15%)."}, {"name"=>"平常点評価", "rate"=>"15％", "detail"=>"Evaluation Details: Toward the end of the semester, students will need to make an oral presentation of findings obtained through a group project. Although the presentations will be done in small groups, grading will be based on each individual student’s contributions to the presentation. This assessment component is worth 15% of the final grade."}, {"name"=>"その他", "rate"=>"0％", "detail"=>"Other Requirements Relating to Evaluation
• Attendance Policy
Students must attend at least two-thirds of the lessons, or they will receive an ‘F’ for their final grade.
• Homework and Participation
Students are expected to complete an average of 90 minutes of homework each week to achieve a passing grade in this class. The homework will include written assignments, undertaking Internet- and library-based research, and preparing presentations."}]

Each test is worth 10%."}, {"name"=>"レポート", "rate"=>"30％", "detail"=>"Evaluation Details: During the semester, students will need to complete two written reports (each worth 15%) based on in-class discussions and presentations: one for the group project, and another for the individual project."}, {"name"=>"平常点評価", "rate"=>"50％", "detail"=>"Evaluation Details: Twice during the semester, students will need to make oral presentations of findings obtained first through a group research project, and then through an individual research project. • Attendance Policy

• Homework and Participation
Students are expected to complete an average of 90 minutes of homework each week to achieve a passing grade in this class. The homework will include written assignments, undertaking Internet- and library-based research, collecting experimental data, and preparing presentations."}]

column6: 外国語　英語　必修
column15: 初級レベル（入門・導入）
column23:
• Textbook: Concept Building and Discussion - Applications. DTP Publishing.
• Supplementary materials on the CELESE CBD2 web page (http://www.celese.sci.waseda.ac.jp/year2/cbd2)
• Supplementary materials supplied by the teacher
column24:
[{"name"=>"試験", "rate"=>"20％", "detail"=>"Evaluation Details: This course has no final test. However, students will be administered two discussion tests during the semester: one in the first half relating to group projects, and another in the second half relating to individual projects. Each test is worth 10%."}, {"name"=>"レポート", "rate"=>"30％", "detail"=>"Evaluation Details: During the semester, students will need to complete two written reports (each worth 15%) based on in-class discussions and presentations: one for the group project, and another for the individual project."}, {"name"=>"平常点評価", "rate"=>"50％", "detail"=>"Evaluation Details: Twice during the semester, students will need to make oral presentations of findings obtained first through a group research project, and then through an individual research project. Each presentation is worth 20% of the final grade. In addition, students will regularly be evaluated on their contributions to discussion and problem-solving tasks assigned in class.This component is worth 10% of the final grade."}, {"name"=>"その他", "rate"=>"0％", "detail"=>"Other Requirements Relating to Evaluation
• Attendance Policy
Students must attend at least two-thirds of the lessons, or they will receive an ‘F’ for their final grade.
• Homework and Participation
Students are expected to complete an average of 90 minutes of homework each week to achieve a passing grade in this class. The homework will include written assignments, undertaking Internet- and library-based research, collecting experimental data, and preparing presentations."}]

However, students will be administered two discussion tests during the semester: one in the first half relating to group projects, and another in the second half relating to individual projects. Each test is worth 10%."}, {"name"=>"レポート", "rate"=>"30％", "detail"=>"Evaluation Details: During the semester, students will need to complete two written reports (each worth 15%) based on in-class discussions and presentations: one for the group project, and another for the individual project."}, {"name"=>"平常点評価", "rate"=>"50％", "detail"=>"Evaluation Details: Twice during the semester, students will need to make oral presentations of findings obtained first through a group research project, and then through an individual research project. Each presentation is worth 20% of the final grade. In addition, students will regularly be evaluated on their contributions to discussion and problem-solving tasks assigned in class.This component is worth 10% of the final grade."}, {"name"=>"その他", "rate"=>"0％", "detail"=>"Other Requirements Relating to Evaluation
• Attendance Policy
Students must attend at least two-thirds of the lessons, or they will receive an ‘F’ for their final grade.
• Homework and Participation
Students are expected to complete an average of 90 minutes of homework each week to achieve a passing grade in this class. The homework will include written assignments, undertaking Internet- and library-based research, collecting experimental data, and preparing presentations."}]

• Attendance Policy

• Attendance Policy

column24: [{"name"=>"レポート", "rate"=>"100％", "detail"=>"レポート提出の機会は5回以上与える（昨年度の場合には10部まで提出することが可能であった）。課題とされたレポートはすべてを提出する必要はなく、選択的に提出できるが、最低でも2回は提出しなければならない。各々のレポートは50点満点で採点し、高得点のもの2つの合計点をもって成績とする。つまり、レポートを3回提出し、各々の得点が42点、37点、40点であった場合には、42点＋40点＝82点が成績となる。また、質疑応答などによる講義への貢献も評価する。例えば、レポートの成績が86点であった者が講義への貢献で5点を得ていたならば、最終的に成績は91点となる。"}]

column24: [{"name"=>"レポート", "rate"=>"70％", "detail"=>"講義期間終了後に作成・提出を求める。(1)授業内容を充分に吟味しているか、(2)資料の活用（引き写しではない）ができているか、(3)受講者自身の具体的な思考努力がいかに行われているかによって、11段階で評価する。レポート提出がない場合は平常点にかかわりなく不可とする。"}, {"name"=>"平常点評価", "rate"=>"30％", "detail"=>"講義期間中6回程度のコメントシート提出を求める。授業内容に対し、受講者自身の具体的な思考努力がいかに行われているかによって5段階で評価する。コメントシート提出が皆無の者はレポート提出資格を失う。"}]

column23: 幾冊か候補の教科書があります。それらを開講日に持参します。その中から皆さんと相談の上、決めます。決めた教科書が皆さんの手元に届くまでは、プリントを配布して対応します。あるいは、皆さん各人各様の履修パターンを経て例年このクラスを受講されているので、その間にフランス語の文法のおさらい（人によっては未習文法の学習）をしていてもいいのではないかと思っています。

column24: [{"name"=>"平常点評価", "rate"=>"100％", "detail"=>"単位を取得するためには、演習成績が60％以上で、かつ総合成績が60％以上でなければならない。総合成績評価は、概ね演習60％、輪講発表10％、輪講での質問回数30％である。欠席数により減点する。　In order to get the credit, the score of the exercise must be more than or equal to 60%, and the total score must be more than or equal to 60%. The total score will be based on the exercise (60%), the presentation (10%), and the number of questions to other students’ presentations (30%). The number of absences from the class decreases the total score."}]

There is no prescribed textbook, but students are recommended to read up on an introductory physics textbook that discusses waves and thermodynamics, such as “University Physics", 14th Edition, by Young and Freedman. The concepts discussed in “The Feynman Lectures on Physics”, Vol. 1, will provide much stimulating thought. Interested students can find a wealth of information on the physics of music in “How Music Works” by John Powell.

column3: 基礎物理学A　基幹(6)
column15: 初級レベル（入門・導入）
column23:
1．力学　植松恒夫著　学術図書出版社
2．考える力学　兵藤俊夫著　学術出版社

のいずれかを推奨。講義ノートは主に1．をベースに2．で補いながら作成されている。
内容はほとんど違いはないが（2．は解析力学まで解説）、
1．は数式の展開が詳しくやや高度、2．は言葉による物理的説明が詳しい。
どちらか自分に合ったものを1冊選び、他方を学生読書室などで参照するという方法も可。
ガイダンス後に購入するのでもよい。

column3: 化学C　再履修
column15: 初級レベル（入門・導入）
column23:
講義は
「一般化学（三訂版）」長島弘三・富田　功著（裳華房）
に沿って進めるが、化学が苦手な人は必要に応じて
「理工系学生のための化学基礎」野村浩康・川泉文男共編（学術図書出版）
「絵解きで分かる基礎化学」岸川卓史・成田彰・渡辺祐司・斉藤潔・森安勝　共著（オーム社）
といった、化学の基礎に関する教科書も参照して理解を深めることを推奨する。
column24:
[{"name"=>"試験", "rate"=>"85％", "detail"=>"中間テストと期末テスト。
基礎的な語句や計算に関する問題が解けるか。
講義中に話した内容が理解できているか。"}, {"name"=>"レポート", "rate"=>"0％", "detail"=>"講義の到達目標に沿ったレポートを課す場合があります。"}, {"name"=>"平常点評価", "rate"=>"15％", "detail"=>"講義毎のミニテスト、あるいは出席点。
講義中に説明した内容を理解し、関連する例題が解けるか。"}]

column3: 化学C　再履修
column15: 初級レベル（入門・導入）
column23:
「一般化学（三訂版）」長島弘三・富田　功著（裳華房）
に沿って講義を進めるが、化学が苦手な人は必要に応じて、
「化学・入門編」日本化学会　化学教育協議会「グループ・化学の本21」編（化学同人）
「化学入門（大学生のための基礎シリーズ）」下井守・村田滋著（東京化学同人）
「一般化学（化学教科書シリーズ）」竹本喜一・伊藤克子共著（丸善出版）
などの科学の基礎に関する教科書も参照して理解を深めることを推奨する。

column3: 幾何学B2
column15: 上級レベル
column23:
講義のはじめに，テキスト（講義ノート）を配布する．

2冊配布する．1冊目は，この講義に沿ったものであり，演習問題や過去問なども載っている．
2冊目は微分形式，ドラームコホモロジーなど，現代幾何学の基礎が載っているが，この講義では使用しない．
